p: The important role of neuroinflammation mediated by glial and immune cells that are active players in the pathogenesis of ALS is emerging [ 17]. Therefore, we have focused first on neuroinflammation in our ALS patient population, as numerous inflammatory proteins have been previously shown to be altered by this disease [ 40, 41]. In our study, there were significant differences in C3 and C4 concentration between study groups. Importantly, before cell transplantation, group I presented higher C3 and lower C4 levels than group II. After Lin- cells transplantation, C3 levels decreased in group I, but increased in patients from group II, whose neurological condition deteriorated in course of ALS.
